title: Failed to deserialize response
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (59f026f 2023-05-24T00:03:36.014601205Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge script

### Operating System

None

### Describe the bug

I have a quite weird bug when running a script against metis rpc `https://andromeda.metis.io/?owner=1088` 

When I run this script:
```sh
make minimal-metis-example
forge script src/MinimalMetisExample.s.sol:MinimalMetisExample --rpc-url metis -vv
[тав] Compiling...
No files changed, compilation skipped
2023-05-30T13:44:31.150097Z ERROR etherscan: Failed to deserialize response: EOF while parsing a value at line 1 column 0 res=""
Script ran successfully.
```
It passes successfully, but throws some `etherscan` error, which seems weird as there's no `etherscan` on metis.
It seems to be coming from here: https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/blob/8a74677a00e877d8be1628e9295f6b08c94aaf86/ethers-etherscan/src/lib.rs#L206 , but i don't quite understand why.

When i try to get some more logs to understand what is happening by adding `RUST_LOG=forge,foundry_cli` like suggested somewhere else, the error disappears.

```sh
make minimal-metis-example                                                                                                                                                                   
forge script src/MinimalMetisExample.s.sol:MinimalMetisExample --rpc-url metis -vv
2023-05-30T13:44:12.949664Z TRACE forge::config: Update EvmOpts fork url fork_url=Ok("https://andromeda.metis.io/?owner=1088")
[тав] Compiling...
No files changed, compilation skipped
2023-05-30T13:44:13.838172Z TRACE foundry_cli::cmd::forge::script::executor: preparing script runner
2023-05-30T13:44:15.624490Z TRACE forge::cache: initialising blockchain db cache=Some("/home/sakulstra/.foundry/cache/rpc/metis/5914299")
Script ran successfully.
```

Rpc used: `https://andromeda.metis.io/?owner=1088`
Reproduction: https://github.com/bgd-labs/aave-risk-stewards/compare/main...feat/minimal-repoduction

---

On a different note (i didn't manage to create a proper minimal-reproduction yet).
In that same repo, sometimes it happens that the `forge script` is stuck at the end.
It seems like it ran to the end (as we're writing some logs via ffi which works just fine), but the process never closes.
